column4: Blueman-applet should share directly ignoreing network manager should it not?

I have no idea, it should, but it doesn't detect the NAP service unless I start PAND on one of the PCs, and when I do, blueman-applet detects the NAP service, but it doesn't connect because it says connection refused
I've also tried using the NM plugins and the non-NM plugins on blueman-applet, and it's the same result
How odd.. I've managed to share a ubuntu netbook's network with something running arch just fine without network manager..
I personally hate NM :P do you know how to do it without it?
I'm trying to say Blueman-applet it supposed to just work!
Assuming it's a paired device and is active
oh, yeah, it should, but I don't know why I get the connection refused error :/
I even try to remove them, start up pand on both comps and they ask to pair up before making the connection
I have never heard of pand personally.. it just kinda worked... *researches*
Err it is broken foe me too
